content: This iconic British secret agent, created by writer Ian Fleming, has been portrayed in film by actors including Sean Connery, Roger Moore, and Daniel Craig.

You're referring to James Bond, the famed British secret agent created by author Ian Fleming. James Bond, often referred to by his code name 007, is a fictional character who has become a cultural icon. The character made his debut in the 1953 novel "Casino Royale" and has since appeared in numerous books, films, and other media adaptations.

Over the years, several actors have portrayed James Bond in the official Eon Productions film series. Sean Connery, who played Bond in seven films from 1962's "Dr. No" to 1983's "Never Say Never Again," is often credited with popularizing the role. Roger Moore starred as Bond in seven films from 1973's "Live and Let Die" to 1985's "A View to a Kill." More recently, Daniel Craig has portrayed Bond in five films starting from 2006's "Casino Royale" up to 2021's "No Time to Die."

Each actor brings their own interpretation to the role, contributing to the enduring appeal of James Bond in popular culture.
